unnormalised: EdTech startup, LearnWell, raises Rs. 20 cr in Series A funding. The funds will be used to expand their online learning platform to include more vernacular languages & skill-based courses, catering to students in Tier 2 & 3 cities. This round was led by Sequoia Capital India & existing investor, Blume Ventures.
normalised: Ed-Tech startup, Learn-Well, raises rupee twenty crore in Series A funding. The funds will be used to expand their online learning platform to include more vernacular languages and skill-based courses, catering to students in Tier two and three cities. This round was led by Sequoia Capital India and existing investor, Blume Ventures.

unnormalised: LearnWell currently offers courses for students from Class 6 to 12, covering subjects like Maths, Science & English. They also provide test prep material for competitive exams like JEE & NEET. Their platform boasts a user base of 5 lakh+ students across India.
normalised: Learn-Well currently offers courses for students from Class six to twelve, covering subjects like Maths, Science and English. They also provide test prep material for competitive exams like J-E-E and N-E-E-T. Their platform boasts a user base of five lakh plus students across India.

unnormalised: "We are committed to making quality education accessible to every child in India," said CEO, Mr. Rakesh Sharma. "With this funding, we aim to reach more students & empower them with the skills they need to succeed in the 21st century." They plan to launch courses in Hindi, Tamil, & Bengali by 01/01/2025.
normalised: "We are committed to making quality education accessible to every child in India," said C-E-O, Mister Rakesh Sharma. "With this funding, we aim to reach more students and empower them with the skills they need to succeed in the twenty first century." They plan to launch courses in Hindi, Tamil, and Bengali by first January two thousand and twenty five.
